bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Doris Frederick, January 20, 1920

div1.p: Carter requests library and reference cards she needs in order to change a reference for the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Doris Frederick, January 20, 1920
div1.opener:
Book. Bibliography.
Frederick, Miss Doris
The Westmoreland.
2122 California St., N.W.
Washington, D. C.
January 1, 1930
Dear Miss Frederick:
div1.p:
1: Didn't think I'd have to "say the word" so soon:--or rather
the letters:--"S. O. S!"

Will you, at your convenience, copy for me (a) the library
cards (the samll white cards) for (x) Rey, Dr. H., quoting Iglesias
y Pardo and (y) Iglesias y Pardo, Ferrol. (b) the reference cards
(larger cards, either white oryellow) for both of the above gentlemen?
Dr. Frost wants a reference changed from (y) Iglessias y Pardo to (x) H. Rey,
quoting Iglesias y Pardo, and I find that I did not bring back suffi-
cient data (thought I did bring some) to straighten the matter out.
The larger cards (the bibliographic ones) refer to "iii,i. 5" of
Father's MS, "which, being interpreted means" Section iii, part i,
page 5." If I had had the remotest idea how long it would be before the
completion of the book, Miss Brown and I would have made duplicates of
both sets of cards, which would have been a good thing both for the book
and ourselves! Please do this at your convenience, there is no great
hurry. When you do it, however, please copy everything on the cards.
I as enclosing some blank ones for you, also a stamped and self-
addressed envelope.

With very best remembrances and hoping to have the good fortune
to see you soon.
div1.closer: Most truly yours, Laura A. Carter Enclosures.
